definition: to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

sentences.english: First, frequent high level visits consolidated the political basis of our relations.
sentences.chinese: 一是高层互访空前密切，中欧政治基础更加稳固。

sentences.english: The leaders of the two countries visit each other frequently, promoting mutual trust and friendship.
sentences.chinese: 两国领导人互访频繁，相互信任和友谊不断加深。

sentences.english: I remember paying frequent visits to the library for completing school projects.
sentences.chinese: 我记得在支付经常互访，到图书馆完成建校工程。

sentences.english: China and the European Union have maintained regular high-level visits and launched the China-EU Year of Youth.
sentences.chinese: 中欧高层互访频繁，“中欧青年交流年”成功开启。

sentences.english: In the course of the next day the first of the usual betrothal visits were exchanged.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，进行了第一轮例行的订婚互访。

sentences.english: Agricultural academic exchange and scholar visiting between two sides.
sentences.chinese: 闽台两岸农业学术交流和人员互访。

sentences.english: This year President Kirchner and I realized the exchange of visits.
sentences.chinese: 今年，我同基什内尔总统实现了互访。

definition: to go and visit in an official capacity or for investigation
